newsitem.title: USA: SpectraScience says wins European patent.
newsitem.headline: SpectraScience says wins European patent.

text.p: SpectraScience Inc said it won a European patent related to use of spectroscopy for diagnosis of heart disease and detection of cancer.
The patent, No. 0669820, is entitled "Apparatus for Diagnostic Imaging," SpectraScience said.
"This significantly augments our intellectual property position in the international arena," said chief executive officer Brian McMahon.

SpectraScience said it has two issued U.S. patents that augment its exclusive license agreement with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology covering 31 issued and pending patents. In addition, the company said it has several patents pending, including both device and method patents, for endoscopic and laparoscopic detection of cancer.
